posts.post_content:
except that the demigod is \*\*\*roach cannonfodder, i would still dump a [Fists of the Demigod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fists of the Demigod) on each one. the fact is, wither is possibly the most destructive ability in this game excluding [Oros, the Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oros, the Avenger)'s ability to cast 1.5 [pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pyroclasm)s on non-whites (even better in 2 headed giant, as you're partner can [Magical Hack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magical Hack) him so he destroys the colors your opponent uses but you dont). while the Demigod of Revenge is an offensive Linemen, he isnt the best one. there are better and bigger cards for this cost. he is still up there in the great range though. The Demigod cant actually resurrect his buddies if they were killed by wither damage.  
  
i still think Oros with Fists+some form of lifestealing is the best offensive linemen, as that combo just destroys everything with a thermonuclear warhead.

Posted By: AlphaNumerical (8/14/2009 5:01:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: the reason this card is good in competition, is that even if you counter the demigod, his ability triggers when he is played, not when he comes into play. That means with demigods in graveyard, even though they counter the one you play, you get all the ones in the graveyard onto the field anyway. plus they are black, so resist a good amount of creature destruction, and haste means the opponent doesn't get to untap then respond to the creatures, they are taking a beating anyway. 5/5
posts.html:
the reason this card is good in competition, is that even if you counter the demigod, his ability triggers when he is played, not when he comes into play.
